title: Best kits on EA FC 25
body_text:
Best kits on EA FC 25
- The majority of 2024/25's nicest kits appear in EA FC 25
- adidas and Nike continue to produce some sensational shirts
- Ultimate Team users can kit out their squad in some beauties
There have been some absolutely sensational kits released in 2024/25 and the bulk of them are available to wear in EA FC 25.
EA Sports' hit football game released at the end of September and significant changes have been made to improve this year's title, with Ultimate Team offering a new 5v5 mode and Career Mode receiving a major facelift.
But whether on Ultimate Team or Career Mode, it's always better to be wearing the best kits on the market. Why not win in style, eh?
Here are the most beautiful kits on EA FC 25.
Las Palmas Home
Hummel have always emphasised the 'less is more' philosophy, prioritising sleek, clean designs over bold and eye-catching designs. Their famous chevron pattern continues to grace football shirts across Europe, notably La Liga outfit Las Palmas.
Their yellow and blue colour scheme glistens on this Hummel jersey and would certainly look dashing on icons such as Zinedine Zidane, Ronaldinho and Paolo Maldini in Ultimate Team.
NJ/NY Gotham Home
Bar a pretty naff sponsor, NJ/NY Gotham's home shirt for the current season is an absolute beauty, with the black and light blue colour combination working seamlessly together. The National Women's Soccer League outfit are one of the best dressed in the game.
With women's football added to Career Mode for the first time ever, the Bats could be an excellent choice with some well-dressed stars gracing the Red Bull Arena.
Ajax Home
You have to go deep into the history books to find an Ajax shirt that isn't a delight, with adidas always decking the Amsterdam side out in the finest threads each and every season. While their alternate kits often attract most attention, this year's home jersey is the one that stands out.
The thick vertical red stripe combined with the trademark white and a gorgeous collar makes Ajax the most stylish team in the Eredivisie for yet another season. With the Dutch giants in need of a rebuild, they could be a chic Career Mode option.
San Diego Wave Home
Competing with NJ/NY Gotham for the NWSL's coolest kit are San Diego Wave, who have released an incredibly, well, wavy shirt. This year's jersey is very San Diego, with Nike using a beach and wave design for 2024 that's very popular with supporters.
Fortunately, with the NWSL in EA FC 25, San Diego Wave's home jersey can be purchased on Ultimate Team or donned in Career Mode to dazzle opponents - even the CPU may be distracted by this groovy shirt.
Newcastle United Away
Newcastle United's 2024/25 away shirt is inspired by their famous 1995/96 holy grail shirt, with the deep red and blue horizontal stripes looking stunning in any century. adidas, who produced the original, have marked their return as the Magpies' manufacturer with a modern classic.
Newcastle have plenty of talented players worthy of wearing this stunner, including the likes of Alexander Isak, Anthony Gordon and Bruno Guimaraes - or perhaps even Kylian Mbappe and Jude Bellingham given the Magpies' Career Mode budget.
Juventus Third
adidas have produced some absolute stunners for their elite sides for the 2024/25 season, with Juventus one of the beneficiaries. A suave navy blue beauty with gold accents and the old school Trefoil manufacturer's logo is almost stylish enough to wear to a wedding.
The Old Lady's away kit may be vomit-inducing but adidas have made amends with a sleek third shirt that may go down as an all-time classic.
Lyon Away
Despite Paris Saint-Germain being France's most dominant and stylish club, it's normally Lyon who are best dressed in Ligue 1. They have consistently produced stunning home and alternate shirts dating all the way back to the 1990s.
This year is no different with a gorgeous black away shirt that boasts an 'OL' pattern throughout, with Lyon reprising their role as the kings of asymmetrical kits with red and blue shoulder stripes and side panels.
Liverpool Home
Liverpool will be reuniting with adidas for the first time in over a decade next season, with their short stint with Nike a tad underwhelming in the kit department. However, Nike have signed off with a banging home shirt for their farewell campaign.
Inspired by the European Cup-winning 1984 jerseys, the home kit boats a beautiful and asymmetrical pinstripe pattern, with 'YNWA' spelled out repeatedly. The collar has divided opinion but we think it's a snazzy addition.
Bayern Munich Third
This one is slightly copy and paste from Juventus' third shirt but Bayern Munich's dapper third kit for the 2024/25 season is the pick of the bunch from adidas. The colour scheme is gorgeous, with the various shades of red working beautifully on a cream base.
For those looking for a fairly straightforward Career Mode challenge, reclaiming the Bundesliga title with Bayern would allow you to experience this beautiful kit in all its glory.
Barcelona Away
Barcelona's away shirt for the current season has already been heralded as one of the modern greats. It's popularity has swiftly risen since its release and it's easy to see why so many are smitten with this particular number.
A centralised badge is always a good start but the Barcelona crest and Nike logos are also black with red and blue gradients, adding a bit of spice to the kit. Much like Lyon's away shirt, asymmetrical side panels steal the show.
